info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN STOKES COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL NORTH CAROLINA...YADKIN... ALLEGHANY...SURRY AND WILKES COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA...PULASKI...GILES...WESTERN CRAIG...FLOYD AND CARROLL COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...SOUTHWESTERN ALLEGHANY COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL VIRGINIA...EASTERN BLAND...CENTRAL WYTHE...EASTERN GRAYSON...WESTERN PATRICK AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...SOUTHERN GREENBRIER...SUMMERS...EASTERN MERCER AND MONROE COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN WEST VIRGINIA...THE CITY OF RADFORD AND THE CITY OF GALAX THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 104 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Merrimac, or over Blacksburg, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Blacksburg... Christiansburg... Radford... Alleghany... Mount Airy... Pulaski... and Wytheville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
